course_title: Research in Sports and Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy

learning_outcomes.description: Critically analyse literature and use this background in the development of scientific questions that can be addressed with directed research
Formulate and carry out a research project including the development of hypotheses, methodology, statistical analysis, and time management.
Prepare and present research findings for an oral defence
Prepare an original research manuscript suitable for publication in a scientific journal.

assessments.task_description:
You will be required to demonstrate the ability to contribute to and work as part of a team with a common professional purpose. This will include planning and preparation, communication, contribution and active participation in all aspects of the undertaking and completion of the research project. 

This is a pass/fail component and must be passed in order to pass the course.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Each student is required to submit the background (introduction) section to their research project. The background will contain the necessary evidence that justifies and supports the research question being addressed in the research project. Each student will prepare and submit a separate (individual)background. This submission has a maximum of 500 words (excluding the title and reference list).

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Each student will participate in a VIVA examination where they will speak about their research project for 7 minutes. This should cover sufficient information to convey the need for the research, the question addressed, the methods used, the results and implications of these results (e.g., clinical, research). The student will then answer questions from the examiner for approximately 7 minutes.

To assist the examiners one 250 word abstract will be submitted per group.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person/live online.

The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. 

When a student is required to complete an oral or practical assessment item worth 20% or more, the performance will be recorded and retained per Appendix 1, Assessment Procedure (95).
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Each group will write a manuscript based on their research findings that is suitable for submission to a peer-review journal. The manuscript must be written according to the guidelines of the selected journal and be less than 3500 words (excluding the abstract, tables, figures and references). The manuscript cannot exceed 3500 words, even if the selected journal allows a greater word count. The author guidelines for the selected journal must also be submitted as an Appendices with the manuscript. Please note that this is group assessment item. 

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Exam week 2(28 Jul - 23 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Group research project (group work)

Students will work as part of a research group to complete their research project.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Group research project (group work) Students will work as part of a research group to complete their research project.

learning_activities.topic:
Online lecture series

This course contains a series of online lectures on how to write a manuscript for a peer-review journal.


Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Online lecture series This course contains a series of online lectures on how to write a manuscript for a peer-review journal.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 4 To Week 13(18 Aug - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Group research project (tutorials)

Students will be allocated to a research group which will be assigned a research mentor/advisor. Research groups will work with their advisor to complete their research project. They will attend weekly tutorials which will facilitate the completion of the research project,


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
